Wassily Wassilyevich Kandinsky (16 December [O.S. 4 December] 1866 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 13 December 1944) was an influential Russian painter and art theorist. He is credited with painting one of the first purely abstract works. Born in Moscow, Kandinsky spent his childhood in Odessa, where he graduated at Grekov Odessa Art school. He enrolled at the University of Moscow, studying law and economics.
